details.investmentHighlights:
❖Location - Minutes from Syracuse's key attractions. Including, the On center, the New York State Fairgrounds and Burnet Park Zoo. The Silverman Planetarium offers an educational experience, while Green Lakes State Park provides a beautiful natural escape. minutes from Syracuse-Hancock Field Air Guard Station, Syracuse Hancock International Airport and Syracuse Amtrak Station. Additionally, nearby is Saint Joseph's Hospital, Syracuse University, or Le Moyne College

❖Micron – Chip Plant construction starts 2025 – In Clay, NY just minutes from the hotel, CHIPS and Science Act grants of $6.1 billion will support Micron’s plans to invest approximately $50 billion in gross capex for U.S. domestic leading-edge memory manufacturing through 2030. Micron chip manufacturing complex will be built over the next 20-plus years with potential investment totaling up to $125 billion. For more info https://www.micron.com/manufacturing-expansion/ny  Contract business opportunity!

❖ Operational Upside –  Historically, the Hotel has under-penetrated its competitive set’s RevPAR and ADR Index. It has been operated from a distance by absentee ownership. A regional operator would have much better oversight, and the asset would benefit from intermittent hands-on attention.  

❖ Home Town Inn - By Red Roof - A franchise affiliation that delivers lower operational  

        costs and loyal brand customers translate into higher profits for Red Roof owners. 

        Exit Windows  in years 6 & 12 – next exit opportunity is 10/2026   Liquidated damages

        are  $500 per room or $62,500  Property qualifies for an automatic transfer fee - $5,000

❖ Recently Renovated: Renovation began May 2024 and completed in Aug 2024 and significantly impacted the 2024 performance.

❖50% of the revenue is from long term stays / hence the ADR nearly $20 below the comp set according to the 3/25 STR report

❖As per the Statistical Report Y/T/D as of 5/11/2025 Occupancy is up 4 points, and ADR is up by $4. for the same period last year
details.marketingDescription:
COMING SOON - NEW! - $ 6.1B Chip manufacturing / Construction begins in November 2025

The construction and operation of the new Micron chip plant in Clay, NY, just minutes from the hotel.​ will significantly increase demand for local hotel rooms.​ This demand will be driven by thousands of construction workers requiring long-term accommodations, along with visiting experts and inspectors during the building phase.​ As the plant transitions to operational status, new employees will need temporary lodging during their training and onboarding periods.​ Additionally, the operational phase will bring a steady flow of business travelers, including suppliers, partners, and customers visiting the plant.​ This influx will sustain higher occupancy levels in local hotels, be Strong Market Fundamentals Driving Hotel Demand in Syracuse

Syracuse is a high-demand lodging market with powerful institutional and leisure demand drivers:

  • ​

    Syracuse University (6 miles away) draws over 22,000 students and 4,600 faculty/staff from across the U.​S.​, consistently driving year-round room demand.​

  • ​

    Upstate University Hospital & SUNY Medical Center (7 miles) employ over 9,500 and serve nearly 2 million people—an anchor for long-term healthcare-related stays.​

  • ​

    St.​ Joseph’s Health & Crouse Hospital add another 6,000+ healthcare workers and significant patient/caregiver lodging demand.​

  • ​

    Destiny USA, the largest mall in New York State, features 300+ stores and year-round entertainment, dining, and tourism appeal—fueling weekend and leisure stays.​

  • ​

    St.​ Joseph’s Amphitheater at Lakeview (17,500-seat outdoor venue) brings major concert traffic and seasonal surges in overnight demand.​

  • ​

    Micron Technology’s planned $6.1B chip plant just north of Syracuse is expected to create tens of thousands of jobs—transforming the local economy and driving long-term hotel and housing demand.​ and benefiting the local hospitality industry

details.investmentHighlights:
INVESTMENT HIGHLIGHTS

  • ​

    MILWAUKEE, WI – Milwaukee, the #1 largest city in Wisconsin, boasts a strong and diversified economy, fueled by manufacturing, healthcare, and technology sectors. Affordable living costs continue to attract a growing population, creating a stable customer base with high demand for convenient retail options. This dynamic city offers a vibrant community and a flourishing business environment, making it an ideal location for retail investment.

  • ​

    MAJOR DEVELOPMENTS NEARBY – Surrounded by exciting new developments, the area is poised for significant growth and increased tenant demand. Within a 2-mile radius, you’ll find over 290 new residential units in projects like Five Point Lofts, Compass Lofts Union at Rose Park, and the new King Library Redevelopment, creating a built-in customer base for your business. The recently completed Hope Street Ministry Sechem Center, a 21,000 square foot facility with a cafe, urban greenhouse, and job training programs, will further revitalize the neighborhood and foster a vibrant community. Additionally, the Century City Spec Building provides access to a growing business hub, while the proposed $80 million, 300,000 square foot non-profit athletic center just 0.2 miles away will attract a significant influx of people to the area.

  • ​

    UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN – MILWAUKEE – Located less than 2.9 miles from the subject, The University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee (UWM) stands as the largest university in the Milwaukee area and a prominent member of the University of Wisconsin System. Boasting over 27,000 enrolled students, UWM offers competitive tuition rates, making it an attractive option for students seeking a high-quality education at an affordable price.

  • ​

    HIGH VISIBILITY LOCATION – The property is situated on a prominent corner lot, ensuring excellent exposure and visibility to a high volume of traffic. The intersection the site is located on generates over 34,000 vehicles per day.

  • ​

    DENSE COMMUNITY – This property serves the central Milwaukee, WI community with over 850,000 residents within a 5-mile radius of the subject.

  • ​

    CRITICAL DRIVE-THRU LANE – Drive-thru lanes proved to be critical for retailers through the pandemic, and as total sales volume for restaurants, pharmacy, and bank properties last year hit a record $12 Billion, the interest in drive-through real estate has exploded.

  • ​

    INVESTMENT GRADE CREDIT TENANT – Rent is guaranteed for 3.25 Years by Walgreens Corporate, a Fortune 500 pharmaceutical and health service company boasting an S&P credit rating of BBB- and a ± $19 billion market cap.

details.marketingDescription:
SRS National Net Lease is pleased to offer the opportunity to acquire the fee simple interest (land & building ownership) in an absolute NNN leased, Dutch Bros investment property located in Louisville, KY.​ The tenant, Dutch Bros is signing a 15 year lease with 3 (5-year) options to extend, showing their longterm vision for the property.​ The lease features 10% rental increases every 5 years throughout the initial term and at the beginning of each option period, steadily growing NOI and hedging against inflation.​ The lease is absolute NNN with zero landlord responsibilities making it an ideal, management free investment opportunity for an out of state investor.​

The Dutch Bros Coffee is located near the signalized intersection of Taylorsville Rd and Hurstbourne Pkwy, two primary retail arterials in Louisville with a combined traffic count of over 96,000 VPD.​ Taylorsville Rd serves as one of the city’s major commercial corridors, providing direct access to a dense retail and residential population.​ The Dutch Bros is positioned as an out-parcel to a bustling retail node that includes national credit tenants such as Target, Kroger, and Home Depot, and The asset benefits from direct proximity to major shopping centers, including the Jeffersontown Commons, which features additional anchors such as Big Lots and Dollar Tree, and is also near the Stonybrook Shopping Center, anchored by Starbucks and Verizon.​ Dutch Bros is situated in the heart of a primary Louisville retail corridor, with other nearby national credit tenants including Chick-fil-A, Whistle Car Wash, McDonald, and AutoZone, further increasing daily consumer traffic to the location.​ Additionally, the property is less than 2 miles from the Norton Women’s & Children’s Hospital, part of the larger Norton Healthcare network, a major employer and medical services provider in the region.​ The 5-mile trade area is supported by a strong population of 222,897 residents with an average household income of $109,409, reflecting a stable and growing suburban demographic.​

each have an elevator in the rear of the buildings providing accessibility to the top floors.​

In 2024, 74th Street-Broadway subway station saw ridership of ~15,000,000 passengers, the 9th

highest total of any station in NYC and the #1 title in Queens.​ Subsequently, the 74th Street retail

corridor is also one of the busiest in Queens and is home to an array of local staple businesses.​ It is also

surrounded by larger brands such as TD Bank, Chase Bank, Duane Reade, CityMD, Wendy's, Dunkin',

Blink Fitness, as well as dozens of medical practices.​

With access to the E, F, M, and R trains steps from the property, the location is second-to-none in the

neighborhood and is poised to see continued rent growth in immediate future.​

7841 S. KINGSTON AVE, Chicago, Cook, IL 60649

details.marketingDescription:
Presented by Tony Magnone with the Weinberg Choi Residential Team at Keller Williams ONEChicago

Keller Williams ONEChicago is pleased to present the opportunity to acquire a 12-unit multifamily portfolio located at 7831–7835 S.​ Kingston Avenue and 7839–7841 S.​ Kingston Avenue, in the heart of Chicago’s historic South Shore neighborhood.​ This offering features two adjacent 6-unit brick walk-up buildings situated on quiet, tree-lined residential blocks just minutes from Lake Michigan.​ The portfolio is offered at a purchase price of $1,365,000, representing an attractive basis for stabilized multifamily assets with strong value-add potential.​

Property Overview

The Kingston Avenue Portfolio consists of (12) total units, including (4) three-bedroom / one-bathroom units averaging $1,463 per month and (8) two-bedroom / one-bathroom units averaging $1,278 per month.​ The buildings are well maintained, with a classic Chicago brick exterior, individual unit utilities, and spacious floorplans featuring hardwood floors, formal dining rooms, and abundant natural light.​

The properties have a current average rent of $1.82 per square foot, generating a net operating income (NOI) of $94,318, and a gross rent multiplier (GRM) of 7.08.​ Both properties are professionally managed and have benefited from consistent occupancy, providing investors with stable in-place income and low turnover.​

Location Overview

Located in Chicago’s South Shore neighborhood, the Kingston Avenue Portfolio is positioned within one of the city’s most active corridors for reinvestment and redevelopment.​ The neighborhood offers convenient access to Lake Michigan, Rainbow Beach Park, the South Shore Cultural Center, and the Jackson Park Highlands Historic District.​

The properties are less than 10 minutes from the future Obama Presidential Center, which is expected to serve as a major economic catalyst for the South Side, creating thousands of jobs and attracting new residents and retail investment to the surrounding area.​ Nearby public transportation options include the Metra Electric Line and multiple CTA bus routes, providing direct access to Downtown Chicago.​

This location benefits from proximity to major institutions such as the University of Chicago, Jackson Park Hospital, and South Shore Hospital, further supporting tenant demand and long-term rental stability.​

details.marketingDescription:
Transwestern Commercial Services, a full service commercial real estate firm, as exclusive broker, is pleased to offer for sale the single tenant Kohl’s (“Property”) located in Westerville (Columbus), Ohio.​

The Property is located at 133 Huber Village Blvd.​, Westerville, Ohio.​ It offers an investor a terrific opportunity to own a retail asset situated in an infill, high-density retail sub-market, at a location with over three decades of operating history and limited landlord responsibilities.​

The Property consists of 10.22 Acres of land and 99,380 square feet of building built in 1974 and remodeled in 1991.​ The Property benefits from being adjacent to West Park Plaza, a 216,000 square foot (inclusive of Kohl’s), community shopping center anchored by a 50,000 square foot Marc’s Grocery and newly opened 30,000 square foot Planet Fitness.​

The Property is situated at the NEQ of Interstate 270 (over 151,000 vehicles per day) and S.​ State Street (over 42,000 vehicles per day) with access off Huber Village Boulevard in the Northeastern Columbus Ohio suburb of Westerville.​ The immediate trade area boasts other major retailers including Kroger, Walmart, ALDI, Chase, McDonald’s, Panera, Starbucks, Chipotle, Wendy’s, Sherwin Williams, PNC Bank, City Barbecue and many others.​

The area is heavily populated and affluent.​ There are 105,381 people located in a 3-mile radius and 271,474 people located in a five-mile radius, the average household income is $100,397 within three-miles and $107,778 within five-miles of the property.​

The Property is in the Westerville Retail Submarket with a total inventory of 9.4 million SF of retail space and a low vacancy factor of 2.7%.​ There is almost no new construction of retail space in this submarket.​ The average sub-market asking rent is $19.77 PSF Net.​

details.marketingDescription:
OWNER FINANCE

Singh Commercial Group at KW Commercial is pleased to offer Baymont by Wyndham San Antonio Airport, a 74-room, midscale hotel ideally located just minutes from San Antonio International Airport.​ This three-story, interior corridor property sits on 1.43 acres and comprises 30,780 SF of gross building area.​

Formerly a Motel 6, the hotel underwent a full rebranding and renovation in 2025 under the Baymont flag, positioning it for improved guest satisfaction and long-term performance.​ With the renovation completed this year, the hotel is expected to stabilize under its improved brand segment in Year 1, providing an excellent opportunity for a new owner to benefit from early momentum.​

Property highlights include modern guest rooms, an outdoor pool, fitness center, and proximity to major demand drivers in the San Antonio Airport submarket.​

Seller is open to owner financing for qualified buyers with quick-close proposals, creating a unique opportunity for both owner-operators and investors.​
Contact Singh Commercial Group for additional details and financials.​
